newsitem.title: USA: Oracle, Sun to target server market.
newsitem.headline: Oracle, Sun to target server market.

text.p: Oracle Corp said Tuesday it jointly agreed with Sun Microsystems Inc to aggressively target the "workgroup database market" with versions of Oracle8 for Sun's new Ultra Enterprise workgroup servers.

Beginning immediately, Oracle will offer its Oracle8 database and related tools, Internet gateways and application software running on Sun's new Ultra Enterprise 450 workgroup servers, as well as the previously introduced Ultra Enterprise 150 server.

Oracle said the Oracle-Sun combination will offer a platform to process online business transactions, analyze customer and financial data, conduct Internet commerce or share information throughout an organization.

The company said the Oracle8 and Sun's Ultra Enterprise workgroup servers offer an alternative to Windows NT/SQLServer-based systems, "combining reliability and availability with new ease-of-use and automated management features" to lower total cost of ownership.

On Monday, Compaq Computer Corp unveiled a new line of servers that feature a technology designed to keep systems running all the time. It said Sun is one of its main competitors in the high-end server market.
